recipe.name: Angel Food

ingredient_list.ingredient: 1 1/2 cup egg whites (12 xlarge) at room temperature

recipe.directions: Heat oven to 375. Sift flour, 3/4 cup sugar five times, set aside. Beat whites and salt until foamy. Add cream of tartar, beat until stiff (2 1/2 minutes). Add 1 cup of sugarrapidly sprinkle in while mixingjust until blended (1 minute). Add vanilla. While mixing at low speed, sprinkle in flour-sugar mixture (1 1/2 minutes). Scrape bowl. Push into ungreased tube pan. Cut through with knife to release air bubbles. Bake 35 minutes. Invert pan over rack until cool.

recipe.name: Argentina Chocolate Cake
recipe.directions: Sift together flour, sugar, soda, and cocoa. Make 3 holes in mixture and put vinegar, vanilla, and oil each into a hole. Pour cold water over all, mix well. Bake 30 minutes at 350

recipe.name: Banana Nut (Susan)
recipe.directions: Cream butter and sugar. Add egg yolks, milk, soda, salt, and hot water. Mix well. Add bananas, vanilla and nuts. Fold in egg whites. Bake in 9x12 pan at 350 for 20 minutes or more.

recipe.name: Chocolate-Almond Wedding Cake
recipe.directions: Preheat oven to 350. Grease and wax paper four 9-inch round cake pans. Cream butter and 2 1/2 cups sugar until fluffy. Add egg yolks one at a time, beating well after each addition. Beat until mixture is thick and pale yellow. Stir in melted chocolate just until incorporated. Stir in flour, almond extract, and almonds, mixing until just incorporated. Beat egg whites to soft peaks. Add salt and 1/4 cup sugar. Beat until mixture reaches meringue-like consistency. Fold into chocolate mixture. Spread batter into pans. Bake 25 minutes or until edges are set (the center may be slightly underdone). Cool on wire rack for 10 minutes. Remove from pans and cool completely. Wrap and freeze layers before assembling.

recipe.name: Darn Good Chocolate Cake (newspaper)

ingredient_list.ingredient: 1 package (18.25 oz) Devil's food or dark chocolate fudge cake mix
1 package (3.9 oz) instant chocolate pudding mix

recipe.directions: Preheat over to 350. Butter and flour a 12-cup Bundt pan. Mix cake mix, pudding, eggs, sour cream, water, and oil at low speed for 1 minute. Scrape sides of pan and beat 2 to 3 minutes more. Fold in chocolate chips. Pour into pan. Bake for 45-50 minutes. Cool for 20-30 minutes then invert from pan.

recipe.name: Fudge Cake, Vicki's
recipe.directions: Cook chocolate in water until thick, set aside to cool. Sift together flour, baking soda, and salt. Mix together butter and sugar. Add egg. Add flour and chocolate mixtures alternately to sugar mixture. Bake in greased square pan at 350 for 20-30 min.
Frosting: 2 squares chocolate 1 cup sugar 3 1/2 teaspoons cornstarch 1/4 teaspoon salt 1 cup boiling water 1 tablespoon butter 1 teaspoon vanilla
Melt chocolate in pan. Mix together sugar, cornstarch, and salt, and add to chocolate. Add boiling water and cook until thick. Remove from heat and add butter and vanilla

recipe.name: Cake Frosting, 5 minute
recipe.directions: (half recipe) 1 egg whites, unbeaten pinch salt 1/4 cup cold water 3/4 cup sugar 1/4 teaspoon cream of tartar 1/2 tablespoon corn syrup 1/2 teaspoon vanilla Place everything except vanilla in top of double boiler. Beat at high speed for 4 or 5 minutes until mixture forms peaks. Add vanilla.

recipe.name: Genoa
recipe.directions: Beat eggs until light and fluffy. Add sugar slowly. Add salt and vanilla, beat until thick and lemony. Fold in flour. Pour into two deep round pans lined with waxed paper. Bake at 350for 25-30 minutes. Cool and split into 4 layers.
Pudding: 1 1/2 cup sugar 1/4 cup corn starch 6 eggs 3 cups milk
Mix together sugar and cornstarch. Add eggs and beat well. Stir milk. Cook on medium heat until thick, stirring occasionally.
Chocolate: 1 square chocolate melted 1/2 cup sugar 1 1/2 tablespoons corn starch dash salt 1/2 cup boiling water 1 tablespoon butter 1 teaspoon vanilla
Add chocolate, sugar, cornstarch, and salt to boiling water. Boil until thick. Remove from heat. Add butter and vanilla.

recipe.name: German Sweet Chocolate Cake

ingredient_list.ingredient: 1 package (4 ounces) Bakers Germans Sweet Chocolate

recipe.directions: Melt chocolate in water. Mix flour, baking soda, and salt; set aside. Beat butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Add egg yolks one at a time, beating well after each. Stir in chocolate mixture and vanilla. Add flour mixture alternately with buttermilk, beating after each addition until smooth. In another bowl, beat egg whites until soft peaks form. Gently stir into batter. Pour into three 9--inch round pans. Bake 30 minutes at 350. Top with Coconut-Pecan frosting.

recipe.name: Coconut-Pecan Frosting
recipe.directions: Mix milk, sugar, butter, egg yolks, and vanilla in large saucepan. Cook and stir on medium heat about 12 minutes or until thickened and golden brown. Remove from heat. Stir in coconut and pecans. Beat until cool and of spreading consistency.

recipe.name: Pound Cake
recipe.directions: Soften cream cheese and butter, then cream. Add sugar and mix well (about 5 minutes). Add eggs one at a time, mixing well after each addition. Add salt and vanilla. Then add flour 1 cup at a timemix sparingly. Put into greased, floured pound cake pan. Bake at 350 for 1 hour and 15 minutes. Judy uses just flour and 1/2 teaspoon salt. She mixes a lot before adding flour. Wrap after taken out of pan to keep moist.

recipe.name: Kerstein (Jean Stevens)
recipe.directions: Beat together eggs and sugar. Add almond extract and oil. Combine salt with flour, then add to egg mixture. Grease and flour 2 pie pans. Spoon batter into pans, sprinkle with almonds. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes.

recipe.name: Stack Cake
recipe.directions: Cream butter and sugar. Stir in molasses. Add eggs one at a time. Stir together flour, soda, salt, and add to creamed mixture alternately with milk, beating after each. Grease flour and flour six 8 inch round pans (or 3 pans twice). Bake at 375 about 15 minutes. Cool 5 minutes, remove from pans and cool on rack. Spread applesauce between layers. Spread whipped cream on top and sprinkle with nuts.

recipe.name: Stripe-it-rich Cake

ingredient_list.ingredient: 1 package cake mix (can be pudding included)

recipe.directions: Prepare cake mix as directed. Bake in 9x13 pan. Remove from oven. Using a wooden spoon, poke holes all the way through cake at 1 inch intervals. Now, combine pudding mix with sugar in saucepan. Stir in milk. Add butter. Cook and stir over medium heat until mixture comes to a full boil. Quickly pour hot pudding evenly over warm cake, into the holes and over the top to frost the cake. Chill at least two hours. Keep refrigerated.
